Hi again,

Thanks for posting your paper BTW. I think I covered most of what I 
wanted to comment on in my previous posts but there are a few other 
minor points I had noted...

1) I noticed that you don't clamp the number of species, so I was 
wondering why you made this decision. Is this because the experiments 
you compare against also do this?

2) You square the fitness value obtained for XOR. What is the thinking 
behind this?

3) The Tic-Tac-Toe experiment uses the "standard hyperbolic tangent" 
activation function. Again, is this to give a more accurate comparison 
with other experiments?


Colin.


Derek James wrote:

>Our paper "A Comparative Analysis of Simplification and
>Complexification in the Evolution of Neural Network Topologies" has
>been accepted as a late-breaking paper to GECCO '04.
>
>We've posted it in the Files section of the Yahoo Group for anyone
>who's interested:
>
>http://groups.yahoo.com/group/neat/files/
>  
>
